• All majors welcome, pursuing a BA/BS in Business, Finance, Economics, Statistics or Mathematics a plusCompleted coursework in data analysis, economics, strategy, advanced mathematics or statisticsStrong Excel / Google sheets modeling skillsPowerPoint / Google slide presentation building skillsExperience and/or certification with database querying knowledge (SQL, Oracle, etc.
• )Experience analyzing large data sets, distilling to actionable insightsExceptional problem solving skills: demonstrated ability to structure complex problems, develop solutions, and craft high quality project plansExcellent communication skills with the ability to communicate complex information to wide audiences, including executives and dissolve complex issues and detailed analysis into concrete action plansAble to work independently and as part of a team in a fast pace, rapid change environmentAbility to succeed in a collaborative, start-up paced environmentComplex and creative problem solving abilityA team player, with willingness to go above and beyond to deliver excellenceIntellectually curious, detail-oriented, and driven to make an impact on the business Life at Salesforce Our Locations Our Locations North America Europe, Middle East, and Africa Asia Pacific Latin America Our Teams Our Teams Sales Technology & Product Customer Success Corporate Roles AI Research University University Overview Interns New Grads Advanced Degrees Associate Program Manager Talent Programs Talent Programs Overview Future Pathways India Return to Work Military Fellows Our Story Newsroom Blog Careers Trust Salesforce.
• Org Sustainability Investors Give us your Feedback Basic understanding and experience applying statistics to business problemsComfortable accessing data across diverse platformsExperience analyzing or building reporting related to key performance metrics a plusExperience and/or certification with Tableau a plusExperience developing dashboards or performing analysis, collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements, and building solutions using an iterative approachA passion for cloud computing and the social enterprise University Overview Interns New Grads Advanced Degrees Associate Program Manager General InformationRequired CookiesFunctional CookiesAdvertising Cookies Design and maintain key performance dashboards through automationLead ongoing analysis of business performance.

• Com, Google Sheets, and TableauSupport Salesforce process enhancements, modifications and best practices development.

job_title: Intern, Systems Engineering - Compute AI Hardware Platforms
job_description:
• In this role, you’ll get hands-on experience designing, testing, and analyzing the hardware and software that make next-generation computing possible.
• Along the way, you’ll be supported by experienced mentors who will help guide your technical and professional growth.
• Are currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD or equivalent experience program in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or a closely related field.
• Experience with hands-on lab testing, performing measurements with power meters, oscilloscopes or logic analyzers.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in understanding how hardware and systems work.
• Experience in at least one programming or scripting language (such as Python, C/C++, or MATLAB) Good teamwork and communication skills, with a willingness to collaborate across fields.
• Working on interesting new projects with leaders in the field is exciting, but we also know how important it is to receive support.
• That's why throughout your internship, you can expect regular feedback and development opportunities, social activities to connect with your peers, an end of internship celebration, plus the opportunity to be *considered for future Graduate positions (*subject to performance).

• Experienced Professionals Join Arm s Information Development team as an Intern, creating high-quality technical content that makes complex ideas clear and accessible for developers and engineers worldwide.

job_title: Launch Your Early Career with Arm UK
job_description:
• Every quarter, employees benefit from our Day of Care leave, alongside dedicated half a day month for volunteering and a four-week paid sabbatical after four years.
• You don’t need to know everything to start as we’re looking for people who are curious, ready to learn, and willing to give things a go.
• Applications for UK-based graduate and internship roles open in You don’t need to know everything to start Experienced Professionals “I’d recommend checking out the blogs on developer.
• It’s time set aside to recharge, give back, and grow, personally and professionally.
• You'll also have access to private medical insurance, generous annual leave, employee assistance programmes, and inclusive support for life's big moments - whether that's family planning, adoption leave, or gender affirmation support.
• Our roots in the UK run deep and so does our commitment to supporting the next generation of tech leaders.
• In 2025, we were recognised as the UK’s #1 Graduate Employer by TargetJobs and ranked the #1 Best Place to Work by Glassdoor.
• These honours reflect the environment we’ve built: one where you’re empowered to learn, grow and make a difference.

• Arm’s Galway office is our technology hub based in Ireland’s west coast, where emerging talent works alongside experienced engineers to help shape the future of computing.
• If you’re a graduate or intern ready to contribute to ground breaking work, this is where you’ll build hands-on experience while solving complex challenges that scale across billions of devices.
• From technical upskilling to volunteering, Arm invests in your growth and community.
• Be sure to highlight any experience outside the classroom such as hackathons, personal projects, or internships.
• Experience with Linux and object-oriented programming languages like C++ will help you stand out.
• You’ll have the space to ask questions, share your perspective and develop the skills to take your next steps with confidence.
• From technical upskilling to volunteering, Arm Gain hands-on experience and develop your skills alongside experienced mentors, working on real projects that shape the future of computing.
• We offer a range of pathways, designed to accelerate your growth, whether you’re finishing your studies or gaining practical experience:.
